utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We have time for one more test before we move him.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What test?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whatever test will prove there was an echovirus-irus-irus, and he's not cured, obviously.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I've been saying all along this could be Whipple's. Causes arrhythmia, tremor, and mental changes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bad idea. There's no joint pain. Where's Adams?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We thought the case was over. She has a job interview.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Why is she here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause I called her. Bigger question is why that worked.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm here because I have time and you have a crisis and I—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're too busy for rationalizations. Patient made a big downgrade in his personal life. He's probably not eating all that healthy.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Magnesium deficiency?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wait until they take him back to his room — draw blood, do an expanded electrolyte profile.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, he hasn't had anxiety or any trouble sleeping. I think it's Whipple's disease.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Bad idea. He doesn't have joint pain.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Joint pain is common, but not definitive. Whipple's explains all of his symptoms, including the personality change. And it would respond to antibiotics, which is why he started to feel better. Which doesn't mean he's not still sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were right. Counts for nothing if you can't defend it. Book a procedure room. Do an upper endoscopy and run a PCR test for Whipple's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guilt. You feel guilty about leaving.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes, I think that little of you and that much of me. You're nothing without me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not leaving me. Leaving humanity.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm going with my girlfriend. The woman I love.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To have fun.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're trying to make me feel guilty because you're saving lives here. And I think that's great. I'm proud to have been a part of it, but… now… I just wanna be happy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh… no one's unhappy in Greece.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: It just appeared in the last few weeks. He's having trouble holding a pencil in school.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does it itch? Do anything different lately? You get a new baseball glove, a new kitten?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Well, the neighbors put in a pool, so he's been spending a lot of time over there. But, well, if it was something in the water, it would be everywhere, wouldn't it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It is in the water.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: He's allergic to chlorine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No… He's allergic to summer lilac.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: That's my lotion. And it's not in the pool.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it's on the palms of his hands. In the pool is the neighbor's daughter. Or the neighbor's hot wife. Here's some lube. Sorry. Too late for your eyesight.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Endoscopy didn't reveal any lesions in the small intestine. I'm running PCR test now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Found it in my office. Appears to be a gift. That can't be good.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got her the job interview.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And that was supposed to be the end of it. I… don't take charity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good for you! You loon.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I don't like owing people things.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So either you're so insecure that you feel like you need to always have the upper hand, or you're so arrogant that the notion of a favor is insulting to you. Or it's your family, some kind of immigrant pride thing. I'm betting on the last one.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I just don't like it. It makes me feel… icky.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's the reason? Ickiness? You never even tried to analyze this? It's even crazier than the gift thing.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: House… there's no sign of tropheryma DNA. It's not Whipple's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well… we did what we could.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You sure you wanna do this?

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Go a little bit more along here.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Dr. Simpson. Heart rate's 140, pressure's dropping. Get him adenosine, stat.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Arrhythmia's back. He's on Heparin and stable for now, but this could put him at risk for stroke or embolism.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe he got bit by a spider. The symptoms can take up to three days to manifest.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He'd have localized pain.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: LCDD?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Almost always hits the kidneys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, Dr. Foreman. Perhaps you can help us. I can't decide whether to take out an "I told you so" ad in the New England Journal or stay classy and just spray-paint it on your car.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're off the case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That seems like an overreaction.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You dosed him. Couldn't stand to lose him as a patient, so you faked his symptom to prove you right.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That's idiotic. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't apologize. I don't know if you're power crazed or paranoid, but I know she's right. Two lives are in the balance here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, I worked for you for seven years. I know how you operate. So when I see symptoms magically show up right when you need them—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I was your boss for seven years. And I know what a suspicious, micromanaging hard-ass you are. Why would I do this now? Knowing you can send me right back to jail?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What'd you give him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing! You can't prove otherwise. So why don't you do the smart thing here?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're off the case. You no longer have access to this patient.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You can't let him do this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's the boss. And he's right.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I assume you dosed the patient because you're really certain he has a neurological condition?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume you're interpreting my actions in the best possible light 'cause you didn't get the job? What's with you and Park?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I expect my people to lie better than that. Either you're getting her gifts because you want her to like you, in which case I don't like you, or you're getting her gifts to screw with her. In which case, I will be teaching you my secret homey handshake.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I just… I thought it was interesting she couldn't accept that coffee. I wanted to see how deep it went.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But now?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Oh, now I just want to win.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What was in the box?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Gift certificate. The Spa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nah, that's not gonna do it. You're up against a lifetime of training. If you wanna win, you gotta do something she can't possibly reciprocate. You gotta push her neuroses to the point where even she thinks that she's crazy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One more favor. Then I promise, I'll leave you alone forever. Or I'm lying. Either way, it's more interesting than whatever you're doing now.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I'm his wife. We're separated. I heard he was sick. I just… wanted to see him. He's giving a kidney to someone he's never met?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He wants to, yeah. I know he's talked about you. He's been alone all this time. I'm sure it would mean a lot to him to see you.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I wanted to spend my life with him, but… I need to feel like he loves me more than other people. Like he loves our kids more. Maybe that's selfish… I should go.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: Was that my wife?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know. You the guy, the kidney donor?

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: There was a problem, but… I'm gonna try again.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Um… to give it to the same lady?

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: She needs it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay. Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: Wait. What do you — what do you want?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Uh, it's nothing. It's just… I have polycystic kidney disease. And I need a transplant, and they say I don't have much time, so when I heard that you were willing, I just… But I'm glad it's going to someone.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: I'll give it to you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But you already promised it to someone else.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: I have another one. Saving one life is good. Saving two is better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You give away two kidneys, and you die.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: I could live on dialysis for years.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes, and — and then you die.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: And then I could donate my other organs. Heart, lungs. I could save four or five more lives.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Foreman's gonna need a diagnostician. This guy is crazy.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Arrhythmia, muscle tremors, and, yes, mental changes. If his heart doesn't rupture, he's liable to rip it out and give it away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, the "down" vibe in here is totally ruining my Charlie's Angels fantasy. And that haircut isn't helping, either.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It seems like Graves disease or some other thyroid issue.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Is she on the team now? Like, forever?… His thyroid levels were within normal range when he was admitted.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Could be Coxsackie B virus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or pericarditis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What about porphyria? It's a little weird without the rash, but it fits all of his other symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And if it is acute intermittent porphyria, that would explain why his symptoms keep recurring.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's unlikely… but it's possible. What else? I said what else?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, for…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There. That's better. Now, what else? Well, if there's nothing better than possible, then possible gets upgraded to probable.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'll start him on hematin.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, I'll go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what's the answer? Are you now on the team? Like, forever?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause I was thinking of ordering T-shirts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So… guilt?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes, you were right. You're always right. I just… I have the skills to help people. Is it okay for me to walk away from that because I… want to just have fun?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Obviously not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How's your patient?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She died a few hours ago.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No department. No money. And somehow, you managed to con her into hanging around.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have a gift.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It was a con.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The patient was faking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I was. I brought him in here under false pretenses. Just to get his money. I ordered a bunch of random tests to keep him here. One of them was a head CT, which uses… iodine contrast.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think he's allergic to Iodine?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, again. Just don't interrupt me. Thirteen was right. This is a thyroid issue. He has Plummer's disease. He has a nodule in his thyroid. It produces excess hormone. Not enough to test abnormal, just more than his brain is used to. Just enough to make him irrationally generous, make him vulnerable to overheating.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then you pumped his body full of Iodine and kicked him into thyrotoxicosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said don't interrupt. But, yes, you're right. Take out the nodule, he'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two days, one surgery. I now accept that you’re all better. Where's my money?

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: You made me sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were already sick. I just made you much, much worse. Seriously… the money. You're not giving it to me, are you?

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: When you're facing death… some things come into focus. My wife…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You love your family. You want them back. Your altruism was always a symptom.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: No, it wasn't. I'm still gonna—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Keep less? How much less? Just enough to spoil your kids?

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But they need it more than people with TB or children in Indonesia with no eyes? Diagnosticians with hearts of gold?

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: I don't wanna give you money because you're an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was an ass last week.

utterance.speaker: Benjamin
utterance.content: I love my family. I want to be with them. That doesn't make me a bad person.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. It makes you a healthy person.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My mechanic called. He said the work's been paid for.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You mentioned your car was in the shop.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Smile and say thank you. Or I get you G.P.S.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You win. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Your car is getting fixed. You're right. She went for it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good work. Need a lift tomorrow? 'Cause your car is still in the shop.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I don't take charity. I'm just glad it's over.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing is ever over.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thirteen. Wait a minute. You're fired.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Now what? House, I'm starving.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not joking. You're fired. Don't come in tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can work with people who've got nowhere else to go. People who got something to prove. People who just get off on weird cases. What I can't work with is someone who's here so she doesn't have to feel bad.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're trying to save me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes… I think that little of you and that much of me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay… Bye, House.
